description: Message templates for hotline operators with variable substitution and keyboard shortcuts

templates.name: Greeting
templates.description: Standard greeting when answering a hotline call

content.message: Thank you for contacting {{hotline_name}}. My name is {{operator_name}} and I'm here to help you. How can I assist you today?

templates.name: Request Info
templates.description: Ask the caller for additional information about their situation

content.message:
To help you better, could you please provide some additional information about your situation? Specifically, I'd like to know:

1. When did this occur?
2. Who was involved?
3. What happened?

templates.name: Follow-up Scheduled
templates.description: Let the caller know a follow-up is scheduled

content.message: Thank you for the information, {{caller_name}}. We'll follow up with you within 24-48 hours. If you have any additional questions or concerns in the meantime, please don't hesitate to reach out.

templates.name: Resolution
templates.description: Confirm issue resolution and offer further assistance

content.message: I'm glad we could help resolve your concern today, {{caller_name}}. Is there anything else I can assist you with before we close this conversation?

templates.name: Please Hold
templates.description: Ask the caller to wait while looking into their issue

content.message: Thank you for your patience. I'm looking into this for you and will respond shortly.

templates.name: Transfer Notice
templates.description: Notify the caller they are being transferred

content.message: I'm going to transfer you to a colleague who can better assist with this matter. They'll have access to our conversation so you won't need to repeat yourself. Please hold.

templates.name: After Hours
templates.description: Auto-response for calls outside business hours

content.message: Thank you for contacting {{hotline_name}}. Our team is currently unavailable. Our normal hours are Monday-Friday, 9 AM - 5 PM. We'll respond to your message during the next business day.

templates.name: Emergency Resources
templates.description: Provide emergency contact information and crisis resources

content.message: If you're experiencing an emergency, please call 911. For mental health crisis support, you can reach the 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline by calling or texting 988. We're here to support you.

templates.name: Legal Disclaimer
templates.description: Provide standard legal disclaimer about advice limitations

content.message: Please note that the information provided here is for general guidance only and does not constitute legal advice. For specific legal questions, please consult with a qualified attorney.

templates.name: Know Your Rights
templates.description: Provide basic rights information for someone interacting with law enforcement

content.message:
Here are some important things to remember:

• You have the right to remain silent
• You have the right to refuse consent to search
• You have the right to speak with an attorney
• You have the right to make a local phone call

If you're being questioned, you can say "I wish to remain silent" and "I want to speak to a lawyer."
